etymology.description: 素(素) (sù, "plain; vegetarian") + 食(食) (shí, "food; eat") = vegetarian food
etymology.interpretation: 素食(素食) (sùshí, "vegetarian food") is a term that refers to food prepared without meat. This concept is significant in Buddhism, where vegetarianism is practiced for ethical and spiritual reasons, promoting non-violence and compassion towards all living beings.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢素食(我喜歡素食)。
为了健康(為了健康)，他选择了素食(他選擇了素食)。
examples.pinyin: Wèi le jiànkāng, tā xuǎnzé le sùshí.
examples.english: For the sake of health, he chose vegetarian food.

examples.chinese: 古人喜好素食(古人喜好素食)，认为这是一种养生之道(認為這是一種養生之道)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén xǐhào sùshí, rènwéi zhè shì yī zhǒng yǎngshēng zhī dào.
examples.english: Ancient people liked vegetarian food, considering it a way to nurture life.
